nodes.text: Chi Eekway Papanoida was a female Pantoran senator who represented the planet Wroona in the Galactic Senate of the Republic during the Clone Wars. She was the daughter of Baron Notluwiski Papanoida.

Sometime during the Clone Wars, Chi Eekway Papanoida and her sister Che Amanwe Papanoida were kidnapped by Rodian bounty hunter Greedo at their Coruscant home. He was aided by a Gotal assistant, who grabbed an unsuspecting Papanoida, followed by her sister. The two were separated, and with the help of Pantoran Senator Riyo Chuchi and Jedi Padawan Ahsoka Tano, Chi Eekway Papanoida was rescued from Separatist clutches.

Papanoida did contact her father at the Galaxies Opera House during the performance of Squid Lake to receive important information for the Loyalists. She was accompanied by her friend and advisor Terr Taneel, who was actually keeping a close eye on her; Taneel secretly harbored fears Papanoida had ambitions to politically outshine her.

Chi was a member of the group of senators, including Bail Prestor Organa and Padmé Amidala, who had grown worried of the immense power Palpatine had been given by the Galactic Senate. Senator Amidala suggested they propose the ideas to the Jedi Order, but Eekway urged them to be patient. The rest of the senators believed they should see what they could accomplish in the Senate first, in the hopes that Palpatine would see that there was opposition to his methods.

As a young and impetuous Pantoran, Senator Chi Eekway Papanoida's sphere of control included areas of space dominated by unallied trader guilds that often stretched the limits of Republic law. She learned valuable lessons trying to govern citizens who cherished their frontier spirit. It spoke well of her skills to have earned the respect of a people well known for their disdain for government. Her devotion to Wroonian spirituality—visible in details found in the ornate molf-tasseled overcloak she wore—helped her earn support and respect. Papanoida's near-supernatural levels of empathy helped her quell even the most contentious of political disputes. Perhaps her tenure during a time when an overriding Republic was drawing power away from the individual sectors colored the views of her fiercely independent constituents.

For her exposure to a rough-and-tumble culture of law-benders, Papanoida learned the art of the bluff and a diplomatic style more confrontational than the usual measured approaches found in the Senate. In heated exchanges, she has even been known to drop veiled hints at the power her allies could bring to a dispute.
Chi Eekway Papanoida was portrayed by one of George Lucas's daughters, Katie Lucas. She was voiced in the Clone Wars by Nika Futterman.

The design notes that accompanied the original concepts of Chi Eekway's costumes described her as a "Mystic Senator." Iain McCaig illustrated these initial concepts, using his talent for capturing likenesses to place the Senator's eventual performer into the artwork.

As recently as June 2008, Papanoida's species was given as Twi'lek on the StarWars.com Databank. An exclusive action figure produced in 2006 also depicts and labels her as a Twi'lek, though this is no longer canon.
The Star Wars Character Encyclopedia mistakenly identifies her homeworld as Pantora.
